question.text: Which of the following statements regarding female reproductive system is incorrect?

options.text: Oviducts, uterus and vagina constitute the female accessory ducts.
The narrowest part of the oviduct is the ampulla.
The uterus opens into the vagina through a narrow cervix.
Mons pubis is a cushion of fatty tissue covered by skin and pubic hair.

solution.text:
I. The female accessory ducts are constituted by the oviducts, i.e., fallopian tube, uterus and vagina.

II. The ampulla is the widest part of the oviduct. It is the part where sperm and ovum are transported simultaneously by the fimbriae. Union of sperm and ovum, i.e., fertilisation occurs in this part.

III. The uterus opens into the vagina through a narrow cervix. The cavity of the cervix is known as the cervical canal.

IV. Mons pubis is a part of the female external genitalia. It is a cushion of fatty tissue covered by skin and pubic hair.
